page.title: 17 THE SANDPITS - CALNE
page.content: 90 million years ago the Bristol Channel covered the sandpits in Calne.Sand has been dug up from the pits since 1910.The pits were dug out using buckets and spades. When they had dug down far enough water came up.They filled the holes in with the gravel which was dug up with the sand.They are called the "Humpty Dumps".They took the sand to their buyers by horse and cart.Then they used petrol and diesel machinery.Big machinery takes out 15 foot of topping.The "Caterpillar 613" is the only one in Europe and it was made in Texas. It is huge , the tyres are about 6 foot tall.7 people are employed there and there are 4 machines for extracting the sand. On a good day 300 tons of sand are extracted.When the sand is exhausted the area is returned to agriculture.
